bibl.title: In Re: Ex Parte - Turner Jackson Petitioner For A Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p:
In the United States Cirtuit Court for Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In re. Turner Jackson, petitioner. Recognizance

Kow all men by these presents: that we, Patrick Sullivan and JJ Madigon being each residents of the City of Seattle, County of King and State of Washington, are hereby held and firmly bound unto United States of America and Charles B. Hopkins, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, in the full sum of three thousand dollars, lawful money of the United States of America, for which sum, well and truly to be paid, we hereby bind ourselves, our hairs, executors, admin- istrators and assigns fully to these presents
In witness whereof, we have caused this obligation to be executed this 29th day of September, A.D. 1905.

Now then the condition of the above obligation is such, that, whereas, the honorable Cornelius H. Hanford, Judge of the above entitled court, has ordered and directed the dis- charge of Turner Jackson from imprisonment inthe United States peinitentiary at McNeil's Island, Pierce County, in the State of Washington: and whereas, it has been ordered by said Court that the said Turner Jackson may be enlarged pending said appeal, upon the execution of a recog- nizance in the sum of Three thousand dollars to the satisfac- tion of the Clerk of the above enttield court, for his ap- pearance to answer the judgement of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Judicial Circuit;
Now, therefore, if the said Turner Jackson shall appear and answer to any judgement of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Judicial Circuit, or any other of said court in any wise entered, or any judgement or order directed to be entered by the United States Circuit for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, in the above entitled causem then and in that case this obligation shall be no force and affect whatever, but otherwise shall be in full force and effect. Patrick Sullivan, JJ Madigon, b.. for himself and of behalf of Turner Jackson.
United States of America, Western District of Washington, State of Washington, County of King. SS

Patrick Sullivan and JJ. Madigon being each first duly sworn, on oath says, that he is one of the sureties upon the above obligation and has executed the same on behalf of Turner Jackson: that he is a resident and householder within the above district, state and county: that he is worth the sum of Three Thousand dollars over and above all of his debts and liabilities, conclusie of property exempt from execution. Patrick Sullivan and JJ. Madigon.
Subscribed and swone to before me this 29th day of September A.D. 1905.
R.S. Jones, Notary Public in an for the State of Washington, residing at Seattlem in said County and State,
